item.title: Al Jazeera rejects Israeli allegation that slain journalist was Hamas fighter
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Hajar Harb, Chris Dehghanpoor
item.description: Ismail al-Ghoul, the channel’s Gaza correspondent, was killed in an Israeli airstrike this week. Al Jazeera said allegations that he was a member of Hamas’s military wing are “baseless.”

item.title: U.S. forces move toward Israel as Iran threatens to attack
item.dc:creator: Dan Lamothe
item.description: The Pentagon has relocated several warships in recent days as Iran threatens to attack Israel and avenge the killing of key leaders in Hamas and Hezbollah.

item.title: After assassinations, Israel braces for retaliation, wider conflict
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan, Heidi Levine, Alon Rom, Miriam Berger
item.description: In the space of 24 hours this week, each of Israel’s chief adversaries vowed to deal the Jewish state a searing, potentially unprecedented blow.

item.title: Homeland Security Dept. pauses Biden parole program for four countries
item.dc:creator: Maria Sacchetti
item.description: The Biden administration said it paused a program that admits up to 360,000 people a year from four countries into the United States to work or seek asylum.

item.title: Children returned to Russia had no idea parents were spies, Kremlin says
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina, Greg Miller
item.description: Anna and Artem Dultsev, spies posing as Argentine ex-pats living in Slovenia, were returned to Russia with their children, ages 8 and 11, who do not speak Russian.

item.title: Russian opposition figure Ilya Yashin says he demanded not to be freed
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina, Natalia Abbakumova
item.description: Ilya Yashin, a longtime ally of the late opposition leader Alexei Navalny, says he demanded not to be part of a prisoner exchange and was made to leave Russia against his will.

item.title: Ukraine watches warily as prisoner swap shows Moscow and West can negotiate
item.dc:creator: David Stern, Isabelle Khurshudyan, Siobhán O'Grady
item.description: After a landmark prisoner deal showed Moscow and Washington can still do business, Kyiv said it would hold President Biden to his promise: ‘Nothing about Ukraine without Ukraine.’

item.title: Kremlin hails return of spies but says swap won’t end fight over Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon, Mary Ilyushina
item.description: The welcoming of freed prisoners in Moscow, Washington and Cologne, Germany showcased the wide gulf between Russia and the West amid the ongoing war in Ukraine.

item.title: ‘I love my black job’: Simone Biles joins those throwing shade at Trump
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: The former president has prompted criticism for asserting without evidence that immigrants coming into the United States illegally are “taking Black jobs.”

item.title: 3 Americans freed in major prisoner swap with Russia are welcomed home
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Victoria Bisset, Dan Rosenzweig-Ziff
item.description: Evan Gershkovich, Alsu Kurmasheva and Paul Whelan were greeted by President Biden and Vice President Harris as they arrived at Joint Base Andrews in Maryland.

item.title: For Parisians, Olympic summer brings frustrations but also joy
item.dc:creator: Claire Parker, Juliette Fekkar
item.description: The 2024 Olympic Games have elevated security concerns and upended tourism but also infused Paris with new energy.

item.description: Biden also discussed “new defensive U.S. military deployments” to Israel in a call with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
